instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message:
Hi,

Got this board with water damage <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and ISL area.

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> was replaced and now i get <SIGNAL>PVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,42V.

ISL also was replaced. Magsafe has light.


Now have this reails:

PPBUS is ok

ALL S5 and S4 reails are ok, except <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> ( It's generated from <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> that doesnt recieve <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>, it's just pulsing from 0 to 3.4 every 2-3 seconds.V)

Do you think it's SMC ?


P.S: SOrry. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is present and all sys pwr is pulsing every 2-3 seconds.

Already checked <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> again and it seems be ok.

Also checked SMC bypass and fan spins for half second and stops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is required to generate <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> signal.
Are you sure measured correctly???

Post all classic signals involved in Power On Sequence.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message: Thanks informaticos. Had just edited my post right when u was writting.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message:
Both pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pulse?
Do you note pulsing VCORE too?
Get correct 32KHz from <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is OK?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Finally, try new BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message:
Pin 7 and 3 pulsing. 
Vcore pulsing too. Getting 32Khz from 1900 and <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3.3V . 

SPI resistors seems be ok. About BIOS already tried a couple extracted from same motherboard and 2 that are bought new ( from my usual supplier that have sent many working efis) and it stucks. 

Also noticed that VSUS appears after 20-30 seconds when magsafe is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not turning on.
threads.message: SOLVED: INformaticos was right ( like always). <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR> was fucked. thank you
